article:
Imagine waking up in a hospital bed. And the entire left side of your body isn't movable. This was the 16 _ I found myself in after my crash. I 17 _  so severely for my head and neck were twisted to one side and stuck in that disturbing 18. position 
The prognosis for my 19 _ was not good. The doctor told my family,"I 20 _ to say this, but he'll be lucky to survive the next 48 hours. "
21 _ as my family was at the news, the one thing that had been holding them together was the 22 _ that with the proper medical treatment, I could recover. The doctor's prognosis hit them like a hammer, 23 _ any hope. The 24 _ that I might die touched each of them deeply.
For the next two days, my parents kept waiting outside my room. They could 25 _ eat or sleep. The doctor's prognosis 26 _  heavily on their hearts. Yet with each passing hour they become slightly more hopeful that my chances of 27 _ were a little bit better.
With the 28 _ 48 hours passing, although I was once 29 _  to the limit of my life, I 30 _  to quit my life, so they felt somewhat 31 _ . Maybe the doctor had made a(n) 32 _ . After all, doctors aren't necessarily right. Bit by bit, hope began to return to them. 33 _ , they still had no idea what the future held for me.
My survival surprised everyone. It would not have been 34 _  if not for my determination not to quit my life. 35 _  will always happen around you as long as you don't give up.
